message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of making a straight-line drawing of a planar graph into a plane drawing by moving some of the vertices. This problem is related to graph drawing and computational geometry, which are covered by cs.CG. The paper also discusses the complexity of computing and approximating the minimum number of vertices that need to be moved, which involves algorithmic and combinatorial aspects, covered by cs.DS and cs.DM. The paper also presents explicit bounds on the minimum number of vertices that need to be moved for trees and general planar graphs, which are related to graph theory and combinatorics, covered by cs.GT. Finally, the paper mentions that its hardness results extend to a well-known graph-drawing problem called 1BendPointSetEmbeddability, which is related to computational complexity and algorithms, covered by cs.CC.
